# Test bd advice priority functionality
# Note: Priority values are 0-4, where 0 is highest priority
bd init --prefix test

# Test 1: Create advice with highest priority (0)
bd advice add 'Critical security advice' -p 0 -d 'Must follow this'
stdout 'Created advice:'

# Test 2: Create advice with default priority (2)
bd advice add 'Normal advice' -d 'Standard priority'
stdout 'Created advice:'

# Test 3: Create advice with low priority (3)
bd advice add 'Nice to have' -p 3 -d 'Optional guidance'
stdout 'Created advice:'

# Test 4: Create advice with lowest priority (4)
bd advice add 'FYI only' -p 4 -d 'Informational'
stdout 'Created advice:'

# Test 5: Long form priority flag
bd advice add 'Explicit priority' --priority 2 -d 'Using long flag'
stdout 'Created advice:'

# Test 6: Priority combined with scope
bd advice add 'High priority rig advice' --rig testrig -p 0
stdout 'Created advice:'
stdout 'rig:testrig'

# Test 7: Priority combined with labels
bd advice add 'Priority and labels' -p 1 -l urgent -l security
stdout 'Created advice:'
stdout 'urgent'
stdout 'security'

# Test 8: Verify all priorities appear in list
bd advice list
stdout 'Critical security advice'
stdout 'Normal advice'
stdout 'Nice to have'
stdout 'FYI only'
